title: Moral Money episode 7: Camilla Tominey on ethical inheritance and one-night stands
text:
You've been given a huge inheritance by a distant uncle. The only problem? He made his fortune in an industry you fundamentally disagree with.

Do you take the money and run? Or pass it up with a clean conscience? Thankfully, Telegraph associate editor Camilla Tominey is here to help.

She discusses this meaty issue and another dilemma involving a one-night stand and a costly Rolex with Lauren Davidson and Sam Meadows on the latest episode of the Moral Money podcast, which you can listen to in the player above.

What would you do in either situation? Let us know by emailing moralmoney@telegraph.co.uk or by leaving us a voicemail at 07867 162 170.

The Moral Money podcast is based on our popular column of the same name and you can read the original articles here. Earlier episodes of the podcast have featured Bryony Gordon and Tim Stanley as guest ethicists.
